column4: you can test that, edit /etc/rc2.d/S30gdm on the partition to K30gdm , that will prevent X startup
I'm trying that now, thanks.
I don't see a file named S30gdm; it's probably because I am using KDE instead of gnome. DO you know what the file would be called for a KDE user?
I think it would S30kdm , or end in kdm anyway
So I just change the name of the file, not changing anything inside it?
yes. Part of the startup is each of those scripts being run in alphanumeric order, if the start with S.  If they start with K, they are ignored
It definitely got a lot further than it did before, but now it's hanging on "Loading hardware drivers." Should I try to start up in recovery mode?
find all the nvidia.ko files in /lib/modules , and delete them, in recovery mode hopefully
It's hanging at the same place when I try to boot in recovery mode; the last line it spits out is "module license 'NVIDIA' taints kernel"
yes! get rid of those nvidia.ko files
Alright, I am about to reboot after deleting the nvidia.ko file, but before I do, what was the name of the first file you told me to change? Something regarding gdm/kdm on startup
S30kdm , leave it as K30gdm
ok, I'll leave it for now
first rule of troubleshooting, only change one variable at a time
It gets a LOT further in the boot process, but it still freezes after getting to a certain point. I CAN start up in recovery mode, though, which is a definite improvement.
take a look at /var/log/syslog, look for the time it freezes. you might see some clues there
and try sudo aptitude upgrade && sudo aptitude upgrade , see if you have new Xorg stuff
I've looked through the bootlog of the past boot and the last things that it says before ending are network-related, just stuff like "no IPv6 routers present"
I'm still thinking your nvidia stuff, try sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg in the recovery console then move on to X
Well, I booted up normally and I have a mouse now o-0;;
I don't know what happened but I have solved my booting problem. Now, all I need to do is get rid of that Xorg package and revert to the old one, correct?
Things are working so far, though I haven't reinstalled my drivers yet. I'm about to do that now. Thanks for all your help!
